title: David Baldacci at his best!
content: I've read nearly all of his books and the Calamity of Souls is his most moving. I grew up in the sixties and the book brought back  vivid memories or the turbulence and hatred. I hope that many people will read this book begin to feel compassion for all others.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 31, 2024

title: Verified Purchase

title: looking at past ( Wallace) to see today ( Trump )
content: Not for the reasons you think.  The story is compelling.  It makes you think.  It describes a time that I can't say is in the past and needs to be remembered.  Unfortunately we still live in a world where this story is relevant.

title: Verified Purchase
content: This is one Baldacci’s best. While being a well tuned law thriller, the book is a window into Jim Crow in VA during the 60s that sadly, still resides in some hearts/minds of many in our society today…I believe we’re far better for what unites us in the words of our constitution that “all men are created equal.” Calamity of Souls is a page turner and well worth the read.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 21, 2024

title: Hard to read
content: This book had me interested from page 1. And that hasn’t happened for a while. Enjoyed reading A Calamity of Souls and highly recommend it to others.

title: Calamity
content: Timely. I grew up during the time of the setting for this book. We see a tremendous divide in our country today that threatens my grandchildren’s future. This Baldacci masterpiece gives me a glimmer of hope that our country can once again become truly “United”…but it won’t happen overnight. The leadership of our political parties needs to find candidates willing to compromise and work together before our country no longer exists.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: This is a great book. I recommend it highly.

title: great book!
content: I graduated high school in the early 60s and was in Montgomery, Alabama when Rosa Parks rode in the front of the bus.  I was also there working in a State of Alabama building when the Selma March took place.  A Calamity of Souls is an accurate portrayal of those times and one book that I didn't want to put down until I had finished reading it.  Thank you, David Baldacci, for a very good read!
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2024

title: Verified Purchase
content: This is a gripping story of our national struggle to be human, humane and loving despite our differences and hurts. Yes, it’s predictable. But so are so many sermons on following the Golden Rule.

title: Eye (and heart) Opener
content: This Baldacci novel reads like Grisham, but with a pungent and punishing running essay on the meaning of Jim Crow as lived by black and white alike. A rigorous exposition of sad history which inspires personal reflection.

title: An amazing Presentation of the Hateful times!
content: I wanted to think a lot was embellished with respect to how the blacks were treated in the story but, unfortunately, it probably was close to reality. I wanted the Washington’s to be freed so bad but ended up being so shocked at the outcome. It was a really good story and I am sure had a lot of truth in it.  I was glad Jack matured through the story and became a stronger man. I was also glad how the story ended.

title: Inspiring
content: I've read many or most of Mr. Baldacci's books so when “A Calamity of Souls” was rumored to be coming soon, I was eager to dig into his next creation.  The story line is appropriate in so many ways and I could recommend it to every thinking person I know.  And yes, it will be a gift to several friends.  As our country struggles to find an accepting (even loving) path forward, that learns from our past, instead of burying or hiding it, “A Calamity of Souls” is a perfect tool to stimulate your thinking. It's a must read.  Thank you to Mr. Baldacci and all those that helped along the journey.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2024

Even some are people talking,about another civil war,we are so divided. Hopefully this book will open the eyes of both sides and show them what hate can do . Please read this brilliant piece of literature and then give it to,someone else to read.

title: Verified Purchase
content: Set in 1968 when I was a very young man, this novel rings almost too true. It offers a pitch-perfect story that brings that era in the South alive, as the Civil Rights Act of 1964 collides with deeply ingrained Jim Crow culture. And it breaks my heart that the we as a nation are still stuck in the quagmire of racial and ethnic hate depicted, morphed into the 21st century. This is the best Baldacci writing in years, with the echoes of some of John Grisham's best social commentary.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2024

title: Another Truly Remarkable Read From A Favorite Author!
content: I have been a David Baldacci from the get go and this book reminded me why I enjoy his books so much! As a former court clerk I always enjoy the legal parts of his books but this one is even more special. set in the 1960’s South this is a story of racial and gender inequality during a time when the KKK still ruled in large areas south of the Mason -Dixon line. What makes it so moving is that I am old enough to recall some of the events; Dr. King, Bobby Kennedy, the KKK, John Birchers and George Wallace. I hated the violence then and I hate it now. some things have changed and some have not. This was an emotional walk down memory lane - the marches I attended and the fierce feelings that injustices bring to mind.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2024

content: We simply must do better. Thank you for writing this book David Baldacci - it’s a great one!
